newsitem.title: CANADA: TENNIS-FRAZIER, RAYMOND ADVANCE IN QUEBEC CITY.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-FRAZIER, RAYMOND ADVANCE IN QUEBEC CITY.

text.p: Seeded Americans Amy Frazier and Lisa Raymond posted straight sets wins on Monday to advance to the second round of the Bell Challenge tennis tournament.
The third-seeded Frazier downed Spanish Fed Cup player Virginia Ruano-Pascual 6-3 6-2, while fifth seed Raymond ousted Andrea Glass of Germany 6-3 6-4.

Sixth-seeded Argentine Florencia Labat had a tougher time before taking her place in the second round. Labat dropped the first set before taking control for a 4-6 6-1 6-4 win over American qualifier Angela Lettiere.
Canadian qualifier Jana Nejedly gave the home crowd something to cheer about when she pulled off the lone opening-day upset by bouncing eighth-seeded American Lindsay Lee 6-2 6-3.
The 26th-ranked Frazier said she felt right at home on the fast indoor Uniturf surface at the Club Avantage against the Spaniard who was raised on clay courts.
"I thought I played really well because she's a good player," said Frazier after eliminating the 86th-ranked Ruano-Pascual. "I grew up on indoor courts in Michigan so I really like the surface."
Raymond, a quarter-finalist here last year, next faces her close friend Debbie Graham, who eased past Canadian Maureen Drake 6-3 6-2.
"Every time you step on the court you put your friendship aside," said the 44th-ranked Raymond said. "You're friends before and you're friends after."
